text: The Detroit Auto Show is an auto show held in Detroit, Michigan every year. The name used before was the North American International Auto Show (NAIAS). The show has been at the Huntington Place since 1965. It is one of the largest auto shows in North America. It is one of the most important events in the automotive industry. The show is organized by the Detroit Auto Dealers Association (DADA). It has been held every year in January recently. It first starts as a black-tie event to donate to local children's groups. This event has industry employees and the media. The show opens to the public for 1â€“2 weeks after the first event. == References == Category:2010s in Detroit Category:Pages using gadget WikiMiniAtlas
title: Detroit Auto Show
